Approach

I use a prioritized approach with a simple premise, I do not add complexity when it is not desperately needed.

Production Scalability trumps everything, a frontend solution is nothing if it can't scale. I don't mind sacrificing convenience for it. In the same sense, I don't mind disregarding other steps in my approach for advances in this facet.

Brevity is hard but necessary, making the same solutions perform the same or better in a smaller or simpler package. Simple is not easy, it will require more thought than obvious solutions. Not only is it good practice, it helps with scalability in this context. This also means less dependencies.

“I didn't have time to write a short letter, so I wrote a long one instead.”
- Mark Twain

Sufficient Tooling is convenient. It is important that a build of a project can be run with a single command and output a single deployable package, this subsequently improves Extensibility and assists in optimizing for Scalability in production and in the codebase.

I find that Modularity only helps when it will be utilized significantly, and unnecesarilly making code modular in the frontend simply adds under-utilized payload.
